Articles.Content: I have a question - if I model an ornithopter will the game physics model allow it to fly or I should think of some workaround?
I have no idea but I'll reply yes anyway in hope that you'll post a video.
Yes, it is possible.
Stock aerodynamic tend to produce infinity glider when trying for ornithopters though. Magic lifting force from those surfaces.
I meant not infiniglider. I was interested if a swing of a wing will produce lift in KSP as it would in real life?
I remember someone made a propfan engine in stock using wings and a lot of reaction wheels. So on the same principle....maybe? Gotta flap real fast though

Yes, it is possible.

Do you think that would work using structural pylons as the wing attachment? I don't have time to even try it out for the next two weeks, otherwise I'd do it myself.

Someone made a working ornithopter using KOS and IR.

It worked pretty well.
